website_summaries.verdict: The DMP-BD60 was built for cinephiles: it's got the best picture quality available, it can play content from discs and USB drives, and works seamlessly with other Panasonic products.
pros: Supports BD-Live for accessing bonus Blu-ray content from the web
Built with a certified color-processing chip that delivers unmatched color quality

customer_reviews.title: Solid blu-ray and streaming player
customer_reviews.text: My first blu-ray player. The picture quality is exceptional - noticeably better than a DVD. I am running the HDMI output to a Harmon-Kardon AVR 247 and then to a Panasonic 50" HDTV. The Panasonic control signaling between the units works fine. I like the fact you can set up the home screen with the Network Applications you use most frequently. It is very easy to view your Netflix queue and choose a movie to stream. I have a wired ethernet connection. This player makes it as easy to stream a movie as it is to play a disc. The price/performance of the BD-65 is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: James Weichel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Its more than worth the price just for playing Netflix on demand on your TV. The streaming quality is excellent especially for the titles in HD (note I have it wired up with Cat5 and Verizon FIOS service to the home, your mileage may vary) The other functions like Blu-ray and Pandora are just icing on the cake. The only caveat is my FIOS service cant seem to handle streaming Netflix and Halo being played online simultaneusly, so the Netflix service starts getting interrupted. In that situation Netflix trys to lower the video quality/bit-rate, but it doesnt seem to work so well.
customer_reviews.author: DPS

customer_reviews.title: Good Bluray Player with Netflix
customer_reviews.text: I was simply looking for a bluray player with Netflix. This player is just that. It plays Blurays just fine, the upscaling of DVDs is alright, not as good as my previous Samsung Bluray player, but good enough. The Netflix HD works fine and looks pretty good. The only thing that wasn't completely up to my expectations was that you only see the Netflix Instant Queue. You can not currently browse/search Netflix like you can on the Roku box. My favorite feature is the lack of a power LED. Overall I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: hesitates about 3/4 way through the movie
customer_reviews.text: This has been a workhorse for years with no problems except 1. Somewhere between an hour - 1 1/2 hours into the movie, it will freeze for a few seconds as if a streaming video was buffering, then will continue. Sometimes, the movie will start stuttering for a few minutes before resuming regular playback. This has been an issue since the first movie watched, I've just gotten used to it. The machine is 9 years old and still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: good research
customer_reviews.text: bought the bdu 60 with a samsung 46 inch tv. hd 1880 120mh . I am glad I researched and read reviews. The combination of the 60 with the samsung and ultra high speed cables made for the the best picture i have seen on a big screen tv. The bd 60 made old dvd's look like brand new movies (sharp and clear). The first movie I watched was the oldest dvd I have (vanishing point) blew my socks off. It was like living in my old car 38 years ago. Thanks for the good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: R. Little

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Blu-Ray Disc Player. After 5 years it still works great.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Blu-Ray Disc player. I find that using the digital audio output produces a much more cleaner and dynamic sound than using the analog audio outputs. My Cambridge Audio receiver has both digital and analog audio inputs. The BD player is connected to my TV set via HDMI cable. I've been using this player for almost five years. The DMP-BD60 and its remote control still work flawlessly. Highly recommended in this day and age of disposable electronics that don't last very long. This is a superb and very durable performer.
customer_reviews.author: audiohombre

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it..
customer_reviews.text: After waiting to venture into the Blu Ray world, I'm very happy with the Panasonic DMP-BD60. The picture is great, the audio is incredible (I had to turn down the bass on my high-end 7.1 system)!! The player did get stuck twice on "Hello" after turning it on. That was kind of concerning with a new player. It wouldn't power down, so I had to unplug it. It came back just fine. The price of this player was very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Guy

customer_reviews.title: Bought in 9/2009 still working like a champ 4/2014
customer_reviews.text: This Blu-ray player has worked well and we are still using it. I cannot in fairness compare the features of this now obsolete player with the new ones, but what I can do is let you all know that this player has performed perfectly, with a few updates, and is still performing today as well as it did the day we purchased it. We also have the predecessor to this Blu-ray player and it's still working fine. We did purchase a new Sony only because we do now need wireless access via our router for online services. Five stars for exceeding expectations and still working problem free!
customer_reviews.author: GaryBV

customer_reviews.title: DVD & Blu-Ray movies.
customer_reviews.text: When it plays a movie, it's fine. It plays every DVD that I can throw at it, but Blu-Ray movies are an issue. A LOT of new Blu-Ray movies WILL NOT play on it. I've updated the firmware. I've installed an SD card which is supposed to be important to playing Blu-Ray discs, all to no avail. If you want a reliable player that can play DVDs and Blu-Ray movies, stay away from this turkey.
customer_reviews.author: theMucker

customer_reviews.title: Note that this Blu-Ray player has some apps like Amazon Prime
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Blu-Ray Disc Player for over 5 years now and it still runs well. My only issue with the device is that it takes over a minute to start up and load a Blu-Ray Disc / DVD to play (so you must be patient--perhaps run a short errand in the meantime). Note that this Blu-Ray player has some apps like Amazon Prime, Pandora, etc. so you can stream movies/TV, listen to music, etc. Fwiw, I would like it more if one could download more apps to the device than it comes bundled with.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty

customer_reviews.title: Has all the capability we need
customer_reviews.text: You can buy blue-ray players with a lot more capability. But if you only want it to play movies in HD 1080 then you will be very happy with the quality of the HD picture produced by the Panasonic DMP-BD60. I saved a lot of money compared to sale prices in retail stores and had it delivered to my front door in good shape. I don't understand the previous negative comments about the remote, as mine will open and close the tray. Hmmm...
customer_reviews.author: D. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal Great DVD PLAYER
customer_reviews.text: Your not gonna beat the deal amazon gives on this panasonic dvd player. Well worth the money, excellent picture on regular dvd's. The upstreaming works just fine. Easy to set up. You can also watch your netflix from this DVD player. Highly satisifed, can't beat the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Alkire

customer_reviews.title: The pinnacle in audio/video performance and value Blu-Ray for it's time.
customer_reviews.text: Panasonic has released good firmware updates for this product.. keeping the streaming features up to date and as compatible as possible for everyone's setup. I just love the picture and sound of this player. I like the remote layout. Good selection of settings for picture and sound adjustments. Pretty good load times are worth the wait anyways. And usually my dvd discs are up and running in no time. As well as Blu Rays. A bit of a longer wait, but as I say.. worth the load time wait. Also has surprisingly good cd playback performance for a middle of the road blu ray player price. Love it. ***** - J. Optimistic
customer_reviews.author: J. Odle

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic BD-60 Blu-rey Review
customer_reviews.text: I feel, I did a reasonable amount of research on Blu-rey players before making this purchase. For my own personal requirements this item fits my needs. I also felt it had one of the best overall reputations for support, picture quality and sound quality. However, I really have no other Blu-rey player on hand to do a side by side comparison. So my comments are simply that "my comments". I whole-heartily agree with what most of my research revealed. This is a very good Blu-rey player and in my mind has excellent picture and sound quality. I would highly recommend this unit if it fits you needs, requirements and desirements.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great BR player
customer_reviews.text: The Panny BD55K is one of my wiser purchases and overall I am very happy with the unit. PRO's: Unit is fast to start up compared to my other HD player (Tosh HD-A35) and both the picture and sound quality is brilliant. Range of audio outputs is excellent and was the main reason behind my choice of this unit. It was a close call but I chose this unit over a Sony BDP-S550 after careful reviews due to the better audio output support. CON's: Had the player about 2 months now and not found one 'CON'. I guess if I was being picky, I'd like the start-up time to be even quicker (from power-on to playing a DB disk).
customer_reviews.author: S.Cutter

customer_reviews.title: Works great, great value
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic value and a great Blu-Ray player for the money. I am a video editor by trade and the deal is that aside from features all of these are pretty much the same. I trust the Panasonic brand and have not been disappointed as mine still works great. All the right features, these things are pretty cheap and if you are looking for a decent one I would recommend this one having used mine for over a few years now.
customer_reviews.author: Lamanator Reviews

customer_reviews.title: good mainstream blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: I like this blu-ray player, which was my introduction to modern home theater. Hook this baby up to your computer network, and you can easily hook into Panasonic's Viera Cast, which allows you to download movies from Amazon. It is easy to use, and makes it a lot easier to watch movies at home without having to return the discs to the video store. As for the player part, it is easy to use, has a great picture, although it is a little slow to start reading the discs. The prices of blu-ray players is dropping like stones, so I would definitely recommend getting one, and this is a very good all purpose one to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Nice player
customer_reviews.text: This is a great player for under $120. I didn't get out a stopwatch and measure boot time, but I did play some DVD's and Blu-Ray's. I also run a Cat-5 cable and played with the streaming. Everything worked very well and I am quit pleased.
customer_reviews.author: K. Neumann

customer_reviews.title: A decent, inexpensive Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any issues with quality (picture, sound or otherwise) or ability to play anything. It's a little slow getting started but works fine once playback starts. You can't drive speakers directly from the player (except for 2-channel stereo) but who has a 5.1 or 7.1 set of speakers you plug directly into your Blu-ray player anyhow? The digital optical sound output works fine with my 6-year-old Yamaha receiver. If all you need is a decent Blu-ray player, this one fits the bill at a very reasonable price. The user interface for finding material on Amazon Video-on-Demand is pretty bad but just having the capability is a feature.
customer_reviews.author: MAT_Blue

customer_reviews.title: No reason to second-guess purchasing
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Panasonic DMP-BD65 Blu-Ray disc players for both streaming and DVDs, the first one for about 18 months and the second for about 10 months. Both are hardwired via ethernet, and I have no complaints with performance overall. I opted for these players rather than a stand-alone media streaming device as it is nice to have both capabilities in one unit. So far, I've had no reason to second-guess purchasing these players, and their set up, performance, and features seem appropriate for a sub $100 purchase. (Not sure why the current prices are so high---I would not have paid $170.)
customer_reviews.author: loce_the_wizard

customer_reviews.title: flawless - I would change this to a 3 star review if I could
customer_reviews.text: This player has been flawless. Picture is pristine on blu-ray and very good on standard DVD. Some DVD's are so good I forget I am wathcing a DVD and think it is a blu-ray. Sound is excellent. The player is also fast, easy to use overall. I have no complaints. EDIT- starting to have problems with this machine playing blu ray. Freezes up about half the time with rental discs. Some of the discs had very small scratches but this was enough to stop the machine from playing. Some discs were spotless and still having proplem. It comes up as a "copywright error" message and if you google this it is quite common on these players.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Upside, downside
customer_reviews.text: The bD65 is as promised by panasonic, a solid value and great performer. It works and plays well with other brands of quality home theater gear and allows you to retain your collection of hard to find DVDs without sacrificing image quality (not bluray, but quite acceptable). There is always a caviat and for the Panasonic line, it is this. The Viera feature will confuse some other switching devices completely so if you are not using a Denon, Yamaha or marantz AVReceiver, and find that an HDMI source selector is not responsive, turn viera off and you will be in the mix. HT Professional
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: This unit works fine. It does freeze once in a blue moon due to the low refresh rate. The biggest complaint is that in order to select subtitles you have to go through several button selections to get there. It would have been nice to have a subtitle button on the remote. You can't beat the price for what you get. I bought two of these and have been pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Peck

customer_reviews.title: Nice Blu-Ray player
customer_reviews.text: This has pretty much everything I want from a Blu-ray player, and some things I will probably never use. The reason it didn't get five stars was because every once in awhile it has problems reading discs (I put a disc in, it doesn't do anything, and I have to restart the player to get it read). It does a good job of scaling up the DVDs I put in and, of course, the blu-ray discs played on it look like one would expect. I've only tried it with one tv, so I can't really say too much about that, though. Controls are easy to understand and setup was pretty painless.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey D.

customer_reviews.title: Bought two units and both aren't working right. One ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two units and both aren't working right. One won't play bd anymore and the other unit skips up to an hour ahead when using the remote fast forward speed 3.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon A. Meier

customer_reviews.title: average playback not compatible with samsung tv
customer_reviews.text: This product flashed or went blank screen when playing on my samsung A650. Samsung sent me a different hdmi cable but it didnt fix the problem, but I thought they knew something so I tried 3 other cables and finally one seems to work. Some kind of tolerance thing? who knows... Anyway, the picture was zero difference than the BD35k. The only upgrade is the audio. If you are not an "audiophile", then dont bother with the extra $$ for this item. I have a yahmaha 2900 and the picture quality is noticable better than the BD55k. but for only a few hundred buck, the 55k is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: E. aaron

customer_reviews.title: Very SURPRISED!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was at first alittle skeptical of purchasing a refurbish item, although I have in the past. And since I did not want to spend alot of money at the time, I took my chance and bought this Panasonic Blu-ray dvd player; knowing Panasonic's reputation, so far, I'm satisfied with the quality and features this dvd player performs. Amazon offered a really good PRICE and I had a couple of gift cards so I only spend about $45.00 and just incase it goes belly up I bought a replacement warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Nadroj3364

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: My expectations were pretty high based on the recent reviews I read on here, and when this player just went on SALE, I jumped on the deal. The player came tonight in the mail and I couldn't be happier. Set-up was straightforward and as you'd expect. I linked mine to the internet via a direct wired cable, so I can't speak to the wireless set-up. Connect with Amazon was easy , as was Pandora Radio and You Tube. No Hulu... hopefully they'll add that. There is Netflix, but I don't subscribe so I didn't try it out yet. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mardis

customer_reviews.title: BluRay that does not play BluRay and can not connect to netflix
customer_reviews.text: Huge disappointment! We hardly ever play BluRays but this sucker cant play them at all any more. It does a great job with DVDs. Additionally, the netflix is not an option for either my panasonic TV nor my "BluRay" player. I also had a problem with a sticky ring inside the actual player unit inside the casing. It had peeled up and no disks could play. I contacted Panasonic and was told I would be contacted. Nope, no one called. I fixed it on my own. Oh well another piece of electronics apparently designed to fail. I am done with Panasonic video.
customer_reviews.author: CVI

customer_reviews.title: It works nicely
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased an LG blue ray player (I think 550 was the model number). In short, the thing sucked and would hardly work without problems. I sent it back to Amazon for a quick refund and purchased this Panasonic unit instead. I actually saved a few bucks in doing so, and guess what? This thing just works. Blu rays look spectacular, regular DVD's are great (The LG looked horrible when playing DVD's). This review doesn't need to be long. It just works like it should in a real-world environment, at a good price too. Do it.
customer_reviews.author: atvkilla

customer_reviews.title: Everything looks better!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned with comments that some had made that regular dvd's looked about the same on their blu ray player--I wasn't planning to replace everything, or only buy blu ray discs. Who would? I was very pleased with this player..everything looks so much crisper than on my dvd player..even some of my oldest discs I recorded myself. I actually think the picture quality of some regular dvds is as good, on this player, as the blu ray discs. My only problem is that I can't get the internet connection to work (I admit, I haven't tried too hard, but followed the set up directions..and nothing). Also, the remote turns on my panasonic dvr..a pain, but no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: kelli

customer_reviews.title: Over 4 years and still works great
customer_reviews.text: The DMP-BD60 is another feature rich device from Panasonic that was ahead of its time. This thing is so loaded I'm learning new things about it even after 4 years. Have mainly only used it for watching Blu-Ray movies and occasional videos on SD cards and am very happy with the performance. My only negative is the slow load time. You will notice on the newer model they even include the "Fast load time" in the title, that tells you how slow it was on the DMP-BD60 but still highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-55K Blu-ray Player
customer_reviews.text: After trying the sony 350 first,not too bad but lacking in new sound formats and weak in upconversion,fast loading. Three Samsung 2500,s, Good upconversion but terrible remote control.Worked if you were 8 ft. or less and straight on. Also fan noise on one unit. Not the latest sound formats.I have a samsung 52 inch 750 and really wanted the samsung blu-ray to work but can,t recomend them. Bought the Panasonic DMP-BD55K and could not be happier.The best picture and sound of all them. Bonus is putting a sd card in from my wifes camera and doing a slide show with crystal clear pictures on a 52 inch LCD. No problems with BD-Live.Best value for the money out there.
customer_reviews.author: Kent D. Zehring

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-BD55K Blu-ray Disc Player
customer_reviews.text: I'd purchased the Panasonic DMP-BD55K Blu-ray Disc Player as part of a Christmas gift to myself, and all I can say is Ho, Ho, Ho, it was a very merry Christmas! The DMP-BD55K was a breeze to integrate into my system (Samsung Plasma 50", & Onkyo 7.1 Channel Entertainment System). The images displayed were increadibly sharp and life-like when playing Blu-ray disc's, and even the standard DVD's looked great. I'd purchased this player on the recommendation of Consumers Report, and after having owned one myself, I'd recommend it too.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon S.

customer_reviews.title: Good BD player for the budget price
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this player in October 2009 and so far so good. I'd been keeping an eye on BD players for a while, waiting for prices to drop and finally took the plunge. Picture quality is quite good, I still think HD DVD looked better. Video scaling is on-par with other players in this category. Haven't played around with the VieraCast feature much but nice to know its there. Sound quality is excellent, DTS and DD material on the movies we've played so far have been very good. My one nag with this unit is slow response/load times, but I've heard this is fairly standard for bd discs.
customer_reviews.author: Sujit

customer_reviews.title: NICE BLU-RAY PLAYER
customer_reviews.text: I'M USUALLY HAPPY WITH ANY PANASONIC PURCHASE & THIS IS NO DIFFERENT. I'VE HAD THIS PLAYER 4 A FEW YEARS NOW & IT STILL WORKS WELL. I RARELY HAVE ANY ISSUES. THE ONLY COMPLAINT I HAVE IS WITH THE REMOTE. FOR SOME REASON SOME OF THE BUTTONS DON'T WORK ANYMORE MORE. I'VE TRIED 2 CALL PANASONIC FOR A REPLACEMENT, BUT THE MONEY THEY CHARGE, U CAN BUY A BRAND NEW PLAYER. OTHER THAN THAT, I GOT MY MONEY WORTH. NOW I'M READY TO UPGRADE TO THE HOME THEATER SYSTEM.
customer_reviews.author: F & A

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: We were very happy with this Blu-ray player. It booted much faster than the Sony that it replaced and let you know that it was doing something while loading. Not just a blank screen that makes you wonder what if anything is happening. Unfortunately, a burglar appreciated it as much as I did and made off with it. I'm hoping to replace it with the exact same thing - just wish I could find it at the price I paid for it! We never tried the streaming video - only had it 3 months! I suspect that worked fine as I have always had good luck with Panasonic video products.
customer_reviews.author: C. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Lemon
customer_reviews.text: It has been barely a year that we have had this Blue Ray, haven't overly used it or under used it pretty much basic usage and it is already burning out. Every DVD we play Blue Ray or not flickers, goes dark and loses it's signal frequently. At first I thought it was the DVD then after watching about 3 additional movies realized it was the Blue Ray not the DVD's. I would like to send it back but since it has been just over a year (purchased November 22 2010) It is past the warranty period. I will not buy another Panasonic product.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP--BD65 Blu-Ray Disc player
customer_reviews.text: It was time to get rid of my old player/recorder that did not work well with a recently purchased flat screen. The price was superior to Wal-Mart, Best Buy and other local retailers as well as online. With Amazon's free shipping, why not. Set up was a breeze, but to be honest, 95% of my usage will be to watch dvd's. Works great for that. The remote is easy to use. Also no need to pay outrageous price for HDMI cables. Multibridge cables from Amazon work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine. Well done!
customer_reviews.text: Already have a BD85 in the living room, but I wanted to be able to go wireless with Netflix in the bedroom. Since the BD 85 came with the wireless dongle, and since it's hardwired to my router, I used the dongle on the BD65. Works great! Mission accomplished with flying colors. I had an older Sony BD player in the bedroom, but the BD65 outclasses it by a mile in BD picture quality. Just a great machine. And, the latest 1.51 firmware update works perfectly. This is great bang for the buck indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: The Best Blu-Ray Player in its Price Range
customer_reviews.text: Not all Blu-Ray players are created equal, and the DMP-BD60 is easily the best in its price class. The picture quality is absolutely amazing, plus it upconverts your older DVDs, and makes them look even better. Great clarity, vivid colors, rich sound. The Amazon reviews speak for themselves, this is the best investment that you could ever make if you're shopping for your first Blu-Ray player. I'm an Amazon-verified buyer of this great little player, and it's easily one of the best purchases I've ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Weyland

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-BD55K-good machine
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the Sony BDP-S350. Panasonic is faster loading and starting (I use the open/close function in my remote macro to turn the machine on and it takes 15 seconds). The picture controls are very good and the image is a little sharper than the Sony. But the biggest difference appears in 24 frame mode when panning across a moving scene. The Sony jittered the picture a little bit. The Panasonic keeps the image more solid (not completely solid) but far less distracting than the Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Builder One

customer_reviews.title: Good Blueray Player
customer_reviews.text: I played CARS in Blueray and the movie looks gorgeous and sounds great. My only beef so far is with the music playing mode. There is no shuffle!!!! The only way to play an mp3 cd is playing the cd straight through. I was hoping this very simply feature would be implemented so that I could toss my cd player, but alas I cannot. Come on panasonic, this is such a simple feature to implement, please provide on next firmware update!!!! I am currently on firmware version 2.2.
customer_reviews.author: David Devine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old Sony BDP-300 died. I spent weeks researching new players and kept coming back to the Panasonic, not only because of the solid reviews, but because we have a Panasonic plasma tv. It arrived yesterday, it took 5 minutes to hook up, and all I can say is WOW! The loading time is minimal compared to the Sony. The difference in all of our Blu-rays and regular dvd's is positively stunning. The colors are intensely gorgeous and I can tell you, the clarity is light years better than on the Sony. We are jaw-dropped at what, for the first time, makes real use of our tv. I recommend this player without hesitation or reservation!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Good Picture But a little Slow Loading & Between Menus
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says, this thing works fine & renders a very good picture. I have a Panisonic TV & it integrates with it very well....my T.V. remote pointed at the T.V. controls this player & the player can be locked away after inserting the disc....also both will shut off when i turn the T.V. off after the show is over. The only issue would be that it takes a long time to load up the disc, open/close the disc slot & change menus. This is the only blu ray player i've used, but its much slower than any of my other 3 DVD players.
customer_reviews.author: J. Park

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Blu ray player!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used just about every feature on this player and so far...it hasn't let me down. The picture and sound are unbelievable. From blu ray discs to regular dvds...this player delivered with quality. You probably will NOT find a better player on the market for the price! ($199) Just yesterday...'Amazon On Demand' came online and Viera Cast has enable this player to deliver a video store in your living room. This feature works flawless. Just make sure you have a good broadband connection and you're good to go. It's been awhile since I've been this thrilled in making an electronic device purchase. It is safe to buy this player.
customer_reviews.author: Nola-Tronics

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: I like it, has a lot of features and I haven't used them all for lack of knowledge. Still need to learn more about it. As far as playing discs it's awesome, very clear and the sound quality will be only as good as your sound system you have. The remote is responsive but not as quick as I like but I think it's true with most disc players.
customer_reviews.author: 2hawk feathers

customer_reviews.title: Nice entry level Blu-Ray
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about one year ago and really did not take it out of the box until recently. After reading reviews, the first thing I did was upgrade the firmware. I am pleased with the on demand features, I did not have to use an SD card for swap space for streaming. The player has played every disc without error. There are other players with more features but this performs very nicely and for the money, I am not sure if there is a better buy out there.
customer_reviews.author: GalvezGuy

customer_reviews.title: panasonic DMP BD 60
customer_reviews.text: This blue ray player works very well and has a great amount of features and the price cannot be beat. The remote is a good design as well. My only minor complaint is the player can somtetimes take a little while to respond and if you pause a movie for too long you have to go back into the menu and select your chapter as it does not remember where you were when it auto shut off and the menu is slow to load. Probably no slower than others in this price range. Excellent picture and sound!
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for money
customer_reviews.text: Got it on Amazon. As always delivery was quick. Connected to TV/Internet and downloaded update 2.2 in just few minutes. UI interface is clean. Best part was connecting to You Tube. Displays you tube videos very well. Only ugly part is entering search information using remote. To avoid this just update your playlist and favorites from computer and later access them from your BD Player. Picasa works very well. MP3 mode is great. Just use your USB stick and enjoy music. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: HSB

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: The Panasonic DMP-BD65 is a superb Blu-Ray player for the price. The menu is simple and easy to navigate which makes configuration a doddle. The picture quality is excellent and the load time is very quick (I timed it at four seconds) when compared to other players. DVD upconversion is solid although I have a Denon DVD player which does a better job of upconverting DVDs via HDMI, so I use that instead for standard definition films. All in all, a nice piece of kit and a steal at the price.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cox

customer_reviews.title: No worse or better than most BPC (Black Plastic Cr@p)
customer_reviews.text: Basic consumer electronics, built to last a year or so. No worse or better than most BPC (Black Plastic Cr@p)
customer_reviews.author: BigBossMan

customer_reviews.title: Very good easy and to use
customer_reviews.text: This player works great for disks and for Netflix streaming video. The menus are clunky to use but manageable. Using the Panasonic "easy-setup", this player was extremely easy to setup and use. I only had one problem and that was when the unit updated its firmware to version 1.43 which disabled Netflix. It took Panasonic 2 days to release a new firmware version to fix this issue. This is a great player for the money.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BLU-RAY PLAYER
customer_reviews.text: AFTER READING MANY REVIEWS I BOUGHT THIS PLAYER TO GO WITH MY PANASONIC VIERA LCD TV. GOOD DEAL FOR THE PRICE PLAYS ALMOST EVERY DVD/BLU RAY I HAVE EVER PUT IN IT. OK LOAD TIMES. AFTER SEVERAL YEARS OF USE STILL WORKS PERFECTLY. WOULD RECOMMEND TO ANY ONE.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Solat

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-Ray player to have with your Panasonic HD TV.
customer_reviews.text: I was told by others that the picture quality would go up, but you have to see it to believe it. The price was very reasonable for what you get. Even my DVD movies look better on it when playing them. It took some time to figure out the remote and I can say the most important key to learn is the functions key. It gets you to any menu item you want to get to. I also like how well slow motion works and the clarity. A good buy and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz006

customer_reviews.title: great dvd player
customer_reviews.text: great dvd player it does almost everything that i was looking on a dvdv player the only bad thing about this product is that does not play mpeg,divx,avi files. trough the usb port the image is alittle dark than what i expected if your looking for a blueray dvd player and you dont want to spend alot of money, this a good brand to buy
customer_reviews.author: Elvin A. Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent player at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great player and has a quick load time. The Blu Ray quality is outstanding and the sound even improved from my TV (I don't have it connected to a home theater at the time). I highly recommend it. We've watched JPEGs, DVD videos all with success. The upconversion is nice too. The remote has a lot of easy menus to use while watching a video making jumping around the disk easy. I have not connected it to the internet and do not plan to at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Gimshewicz

customer_reviews.title: Great player
customer_reviews.text: This is my first BD player, so I don't have anything to compare it to, but, I think it's a great player. Picture and sound are both crystal clear. I did have it freeze on my once before I updated the firmware, but have had no problems since. The Amazon video on demand is way cool, too, much better than DirecTV since the movies are instant, no download time. Watching Youtube on it can be fun, too. Overall, I don't think you can do much better at this price.
customer_reviews.author: dcos

customer_reviews.title: Updating DVD player
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my dvd player to the blu-ray for two main reasons. First cost of the upgraded dvd player was around 80.00 . Second I wanted to get the better picture for my newer plasma screen TV. For a little bit more I was able to get this entry line Blu-Ray player. It is a bit slower on the start up that my older dvd player. Has much better sound and picture quality. I would say it was worth the upgrade. I have not seen any benefit of the wireless connection yet.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Made

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, this is the best player you can get for the price it's selling at. Just as good as the 300-500 dollar players. I've had it for 6 weeks and love it. Good response time, picture and audio quality are excellent. DVDs look fantastic on it as well. I've compared the blu-ray and dvd of the same movies I own and the quality is nearly as good. Ironically it makes buying blu-rays seem unnecessary. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: CWB1984

customer_reviews.title: Love this blu ray player
customer_reviews.text: We have had two different blu ray players in three years. Our first one was a Sony which was horrible it would freeze up on us every time we would watch a movie. The second one was a Panasonic which my wife broke on accident. So we bought another Panasonic and we love it! The picture is awesome and the sound is awesome. We have not had any problems in the year and a half that we have owned this player.
customer_reviews.author: Glock Shooter

customer_reviews.title: 1st Blu Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an upgraded Panasonic BD player but the price jumped up and settled for this model. Well, sometimes you just get lucky. This player loads quickly and produces exceptional sound and video quality. For people who just want to be able to sit down and enjoy a good movie produced with a good machine, this is it. I would suppose there are better players than this but the average viewer won't see the difference.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: nice blue ray
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this blue ray a few times so my review is somewhat limited. The set up was ultra easy using the hdmi cable (which is a boon to setting up dvd players and the like--just one connection and the results are excellent--hint never buy hdmi cables at a store--they are super cheap on line--super expensive at stores for some reason). The player is sleek, narrow and works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Gene D. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: A WINNER AT A LOW COST
customer_reviews.text: Although a low-cost BluRay player, this Panasonic was given a good review by a leading consumer magazine. It exceeds my expectations as to what a Blu-Ray is or does. Set-up was easy. I am still using a wired router, a LinkSys BEFSR41. I have only had this for a couple of weeks, but I am extremely pleased, so far. It works great with NetFlix, YouTube, and other video programs on the Internet.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Blu Ray for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice Blu Ray for the price. After reading some of the reviews I had gotten a little nervous about hearing that this model would freeze up. I have not had that problem but am still a little weiry. So far so good. Also a week after I had bought my Blu Ray at Amazon for $172 It went down in price almost $40 cheaper. Still a good price though. Other movies not in Blu Ray also look better with the upconversion.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Blu Ray player
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic. The picture quality and features are more than I bargained for with a $ 200.00 blu ray player. The set-up was ridiculously easy and as long as you have the player hooked up to the internet it is easy to update. The only thing that can be considered as a "con" is that there is no memory in the player; you have to buy an SD card. You aren't able to access the LIVE functions without it. All-in-all, I am really satisfied with this player.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Plus Great Features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with a Panasonic 54" Plasma TV. The VIERA Link and VIERA Cast functions are great and allow both simplified operation and the ability to look at You Tube videos or rent movies from Amazon without needing to hook-up to a computer. Set-up was easy and software is fairly easy to use. The only thing missing is an S-Video output. This is a very good value in a Blu Ray player.
customer_reviews.author: jaldeborgh

customer_reviews.title: Good Blu-Ray Player for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, basic Blu-Ray player. It's quick to power on, discs load quickly, and the remote/menus are relatively easy to navigate. You can access and use Amazon Video on Demand with this player, but videos are slow to download. I don't have any experience with downloading videos on other Blu-Ray players, so I don't know if this is normal or not.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Player, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for about $200 because I was sick of waiting for PS3 to drop price. Hooked it up to my 50" panasonic plasma (G10-which I love!) via HDMI. Blu rays look killer, dvd upconverts very well. The only sacrifice is that discs load slower than the fastest players, but I can live with that to save $$$. If you want great picture quality for an honorable price... Highly reccomended.
customer_reviews.author: Adventure Fan

customer_reviews.title: I like it alot
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this blue ray player. You do have to learn how to pause and start again a few times I ended up having to go to pick a scene to get back where I was because I hit play after pauseing instead of pause again to resume playing. Does that sentence make sense? A real nice feature is the "open-close" button is right on top so its easy to find. Anyway it is a very nice player, at this price I'm thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Many options and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I do wish it had a separate output for the audio. The HDMI run through my receiver does not show any video, I might have to read the manual on that, but I do like all the options to play my Amazon Prime and netflix and stuff.. It did not work with a cheaper HDMI cable.....
customer_reviews.author: Brad Towle

customer_reviews.title: great affordable product
customer_reviews.text: Once I got all the proper connections made, this thing pretty much set itself up with a minimum of prompting from me. Had it running for about a month now and love all the capabilities, especially the streaming video and automatic updates. Would have liked coaxial audio output, but optical works just fine. No need to spend more as far as I can see. . .
customer_reviews.author: arlee51

customer_reviews.title: DMP-DB60 Blu-ray Disc Player
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered the player it was shipped and received from Amazon in a timely manner, when I opened the package I heard a slight rattle like something was loose inside but hooked it up anyway and it played fine, I then did the firmware upgrade, after that it would start to play then shut down. I called Panasonic and they said I had to ship the player back to them, I did, they indicated they fixed the player and shipped it back to me, right now it is working just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Crutchfield

customer_reviews.title: I'm enjoying renting movies again
customer_reviews.text: All the movies I have missed I now look forward to seeing on my big screen in the comfort of my own home. I have nothing to compare it to except my old dvd player and there is no comparison, its so much better. I have also been watching my old dvd's with a new sense of awe. I hooked it up to my old analog surround sound system and its just perfect for me. I totally recommend this blu-ray player and at such a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppersavant

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: I have had this since Nov of 09 and it has worked flawlessly. The dvd upconvert makes regular dvds look almost like blu rays. And my blu rays play perfectly. So far no freezes or any problems what so ever. The amazon on demand is amazing and the you tube is fun. I say you should buy this player and I plan on buying this model for friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: B. Espanol

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 46inch Panasonic 1080P plasma tv and this Blu-Ray to go with it. It is stunning, pure viual and sound enjoyment. The tv was about $1,000 and the Blu Ray was like $140 (delivered) and you simply can't beat it. Addmittedly I do run a nice Denon reciever with Paradigm speakers for sound but as far as the visual quaility this set up ROCKS!!! If you are 2nd guessing, STOP RIGHT NOW AND BUY!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry G. Boyd Jr.

customer_reviews.title: good product DMP-BD65 -
customer_reviews.text: It was shipped by Portable Guy and they have an excellent customer care program. Yes, I have a 'state-of-the-art" DVD player, but, this Blu Ray player gives me improved picture quality when playing regular DVDs. This Blu Ray player is more expensive than others but well worth the extra money. also: It plays a vast variety of video formats
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Wayne

customer_reviews.title: There's better out there.
customer_reviews.text: The loading time of the Blu Ray is very slow. The response time of the remote is slow. It's currently sitting in my closet while I use my PS3 for Blu Rays. Despite my complaints, it is functional. If they offer it at a reasonable price and your needs for a Blu Ray player do not require fast loading or a quick remote, you may want to consider it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Law

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Blu Ray Player and was able to set it up by myself (a huge feat) and view my DVD. It was an easy set up and although I watched it on a small tv the clarity etc was fine. I still have to buy some type of cable to attach to it as to allow me to download movies to watch. It did not come with the needed cable for the downloads.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Plays DVD
customer_reviews.text: Everything works well and for the price I got exactly what i paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Kaylor

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: This is my first blue ray player. I am pleased with my purchase. It does everything that I thought it would do. I have had it for about one month. So far it has been a good experience. I have it connected by a wire to my home net work and enjoy the netcast feature, you can view youtube and get movies streamed via the internet. I only have a 1.5 MB internet connection so I do not try to view HD movies over the net. You may need a faster internet connection if you want to get HD movies streamed to you. I would recommend the player.
customer_reviews.author: Old guy

customer_reviews.title: Concern about full disclosure
customer_reviews.text: A warning to those who might want to purchase this unit. Amazon does not disclose the age of electronic hardware nor the current operating firmware. I purchased this unit two weeks ago believing I was getting a brand new unit. It was brand new but it was a 2009 model that is no longer even being made. I put in new Blu-ray discs and they wouldn't play. Why - because the firmware verson was 1.5 and not the 2.5 required for the new Blu-ray discs. Shame on you, Amazon. If you are going to be a distributor at least provide full disclosure.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Wine

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-BD60
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Panasonic DMP-BD60 from Amazon on a Tuesday afternoon and received it on Wednesday morning; now that's amazing service! I got the Panasonic because I have a Panasonic receiver and Plasma TV, so the remote controls are all integrated. This Blu-Ray player is okay but does have some delay in processing commands from the remote. I noticed some freezing on some old DVDs that we played; it may well be they were dusty, but I will keep my eye on that. The one thing that bothers me is that there is no built in wireless and also no relationship with Netflix. I am hoping that Panasonic will contract a relationship with Netflix for VOD in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Kopser

customer_reviews.title: smart function never launched
customer_reviews.text: smart function never launched, blue rays played ok, but DVDS had nothing but problems Refurbished warehouse special was super special
customer_reviews.author: B. Little

customer_reviews.title: Works great until the LAN port dies.
customer_reviews.text: This blu ray player is awesome, however, if you want internet connectivity, look for something else. My LAN port has fried and Panasonic wants to charge me $130 before tax to fix it. Such a waste!
customer_reviews.author: CNR

customer_reviews.title: This player exceeds my needs
customer_reviews.text: This player was purchased to replace a standard DVD player. I have a lot of DVD's and I did want to continue to view them on my new Hi-def T.V. For best image and sound quality get some decent HDMI cables. (Duh!) This player has many features that I haven't tested yet. The price was reasonable. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M. Dickman

customer_reviews.title: Like this blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from BD30. First bought the Sony S550, but did not like. Returned it and bought the BD55K instead. Picture is sharper than Sony, sound in TrueHD and HD-MA is fuller than Sony, sub out did not require 10bd boost. The remote and menu selections could be a little faster (maybe with future firmware), but not a big complaint. Wished the remote had a "quick replay" (ten seconds) button. All in all, happy with this player and will keep it for a while since it decodes all currently available sound format via analog outs.
customer_reviews.author: Sum Yung Guy

customer_reviews.title: First time blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: Have really enjoyed my first experience with blu ray and selected this based on comparisons with other Blu-rays in the market. I am unfamiliar with other boot times and felt this one was slightly longer but worth the wait. Aside from that, everything is easy to use and hope to have a long shelve life with this model.
customer_reviews.author: ljstartrek

customer_reviews.title: my first blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: This product is very good and does more than what I expected. It streams Netflix, Amazon and Pandora. The only fall back is with Netflix, you have to update your Instant Queue online but with the Amazon on Demand, you can search using the remote. I never had a Netflix streaming account with another device so not sure if it is that way with all of them. We have ATT DSL pro package and have not had an issue with quality or download time at all. I have yet to watch a blu-ray disc but we mainly got it for the Netflix streaming. It works perfect with a Harmony 510 remote too.
customer_reviews.author: G. Segura

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-BD55K Blu-ray review
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pleased with my purchase of the Panasonic Blu-ray DMP-BD55K from Electronics Expo through Amazon.com (four days from order to delivery to my door). In addition to beautiful Blu-ray reproduction the BD55K offers on-board decoding of the latest lossless high definition audio formats from Dolby and DTS as well as excellent up-conversion of standard DVDs to near high definition quality through the HDMI connection. Most Blu-ray players I've seen thus far fall short with regard to DVD up-conversion. All in all, I recommend this unit highly.
customer_reviews.author: MIMI

customer_reviews.title: Is Panasonic over?
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing failures for a Panasonic product. Many blu-ray discs will not play despite many firmware updates. Slow loading discs, slow loading updates (on an excellent high speed cable modem). Time consuming and frustrating. I want to watch movies not sit around and wait or waste hours updating.
customer_reviews.author: SINBAD FREEMONT

customer_reviews.title: Good Blue-Ray player for the price..
customer_reviews.text: Slowly migrating to Blu-Ray and I bought this since our Panasonic plasma TV does not have network... Works great but could be better... My wife like using the Youtube network feature of the BD-live... I would recommend the player to others but if you want a Cadillac Blu-Ray player, you will need to pay more...
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jt Payette

customer_reviews.title: Nice BlueRay for the money
customer_reviews.text: I love this BlueRay player. I had a Roku first and I simply switched the cords from one to the other and watch NetFlix on my BlueRay now. The picture quality is perfect and the player is very easy to use. Besides NetFlix, you can get Amazon video, Pandora and more. It's a good bargain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Carter

customer_reviews.title: Nice blu ray
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this blu ray because It was a LOT cheaper than the ones I was looking at in the local big box stores. Glad I did! It was cheaper but it work just as good, if not better, than those high dollar ones. Buy it! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ty C

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted...which was less than a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in November 2010. It's now May of 2011 and it's already failing, frequently getting stuck while playing disks. As a result, I can't recommend it, even though I've been happy with it until now. While it's still within its 12-month parts-and-labor warranty, Panasonic's horrendous customer service makes it virtually impossible to get any value out of that warranty. I'm never buying Panasonic again. (Compare this to my recent experience with a 4-year-old Samsung TV: when I called them about a problem, they sent someone to our house within 48 hours to fix it, completely free of charge, even though it was WAY out of warranty.)
customer_reviews.author: Restorm

customer_reviews.title: BLUE RAY MANIA
customer_reviews.text: Works, good match for my viera P54v10 , Only watched one blue ray so far, to early to comment more. Nice price at amazon.com. Matched my black components also. OH dont't let blogs turn you off when say slow to load, most players load slower in this price range. Would not hesitate to buy again for a gift. Later....
customer_reviews.author: bob champ

customer_reviews.title: dvd update
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 3 months was promped to do latest update after update installed netflix willnot load and dvd player oparates very slow . Called Panasonic tech support they say there is problum but have not solved the problum as of yet I would not buy this brand of blu ray player Model:DMP-BD65K Panasonic
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience using Blu-Ray. For the price I think this works great. It takes a long time for a Blu-Ray disk to actually start, but I don't know if this is normal or not. I use Netflix streaming on this device and it works great. I have no downside for this player for the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Bender is Great

customer_reviews.title: Really like that it syncs and turns on my Sony 40" ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 4 years with no problems at all. Really like that it syncs and turns on my Sony 40" TV. I mostly use it to stream Netflix movies. This was an excellent investment (no regrets) !
customer_reviews.author: Daren

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performer, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: The Internet features are far too glorified; the user experience in using them is a joke by comparison to the likes of an AppleTV or XBox. However, they're interesting if not useful. For the money, though, this is an excellent Blu-Ray player. You can't ask for much more at this price.
customer_reviews.author: argiope

product_meta.title: Panasonic DMP-BD60 Blu-ray Disc Player (Black)
product_meta.description:
Style:DMP-BD60The DMP-BD60 is a Blu-ray Disc player that has a wealth of features, combined with good performance. Blu-ray discs are played at 1080p via HDMI output. This player is compatible with standard DVDs, most recordable DVD formats, CDs. Standard DVDs are upscaled up to 1080p via the HDMI output. Onboard decoding or undecoded bitstream output of Dolby TrueHD and DTS-HD is provided via HDMI. The DMP-BD60 adheres to Blu-ray Profile 2.0 specifications, and as an added bonus, the Viera Cast feature allows direct access to online

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Panasonic DMP-BD60 Blu-ray Disc Player combines high quality images with enhanced networking functions. Continuing its commitment to producing products that stress ease of use, the 2009 line of Blu-ray Disc players continue to incorporate VIERA Link, allowing the consumer to operate their audio/video components, via HDMI, with one remote. And, in keeping with Panasonic’s pledge to reduce the planet’s carbon footprint, the new Blu-ray players have been designed to reduce power consumption.

 

BD Live and BonusView so you can connect directly to the Internet to access bonus features, games and movie studio extras.

SD memory card and USB slot so you can enjoy precious memories in HD Click to enlarge.



Experience Movies Like Never Before
The DMP-BD60 employs the PHL Reference Chroma Processor Plus. Developed in collaboration with Panasonic Hollywood Laboratory, this high image processing technology reproduces clear, vivid colors that are faithful to the original film. Recognizing that audio is important to the overall entertainment experience, this Blu-ray Disc player features a high definition audio decoder (Dolby Digital Plus, Dolby TrueHD, DTS-HD Master Audio Essential) to take advantage of the exceptionally high quality 7.1 channel surround sound now integrated in Blu-ray Discs.

Experience Movies Like Never Before
The DMP-BD60 includes an SD Memory card slot and USB slot, making it easy for the consumer to view and share both digital still images and HD video recorded with an HD camcorder in the AVCHD format.

In order to produce the ultimate picture quality, the Panasonic’s DMP-BD60 Blu-ray players employs high precision 4:4:4 signal technology, which working in tandem with PHL Reference Chroma Processor Plus processes each pixel of the Blu-ray Disc video signal in the horizontal direction, to compliment vertical direction processing. P4HD (Pixel Precision Progressive Processing for HD) is another technology that contributes to the superior picture quality of the Blu-ray players. P4HD processes more than 15 billion pixels per second and applies the optimal processing to every pixel.

Panasonic’s Blu-ray players further utilize 16-level motion detection to categorize the image motion of each pixel into one of 16 levels; diagonal processing to detect diagonals and correct the pixels accordingly; 1080p up-conversion to up-convert content recorded in the 480i/p or 720p format to 1080p. The Blu-ray players also provide 1080/24p output, thereby reproducing cinema images from a Blu-ray Disc and DVD in their original 24p form with no need for conversion. This allows the user to enjoy cinema images in the same format used in cinema with a 1080/24p compatible TV.

Complimenting the HD audio codecs this Blu-ray player features 96kHz surround re-master, a function that enhances the sound quality of CDs and other sources, and even improves the quality of the multi-channel audio data on Blu-ray Discs and DVDs.

ENERGY STAR Rated
In order to obtain a reduction in power consumption the Panasonic DMP-BD60 uses Auto Power Stand-By, a function that automatically turns off the player when you return to TV operation using the VIERA Link menu. In addition, the Stand-by Power Save automatically turns off the player’s Quick Start function. When VIERA is turned on, Quick Start also turns on. In addition, the development of the UniPhier single chip LSI makes it possible to pack an entire video signal processing circuit onto a single chip. This helps lower power consumption, reduces the number of parts needed and allows for a more compact design. In fact, the DMP-BD60 consumes 16% less power in standby mode than last year’s model, the DMP-BD35.

Key Features Include
PHL Reference Chroma Processor Plus for faithful and sharp color reproduction BD Live and BonusView so you can connect directly to the Internet to access bonus features, games and movie studio extras SD memory card and USB slot so you can enjoy precious memories in HD High precision 4:4:4 24p cinema mode 7.1ch lossless audio decode and bit-stream output VIERA Link ENERGY STAR rated consumes 10 percent less power than DMP-BD35 What's in the box
Panasonic DMP-BD60 Blu-ray Disc Player, remote control, instruction manual
feature_bullets: Film makers version with PHL Chip for accurate color
SD Card Slot and USB slot
Viera Cast connecting you with YouTube, Picasa, Weather
Viera Cast connecting you with YouTube, Picasa, Weather.
SD Card Slot and USB slot
Film makers version with PHL Chip for accurate color

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars908 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
